For ideas and feedback, visit +BetaFeedback

body:
@captainmeta4 pulled the classic AHS tactic of banning a user so that his friend @carpathianflorist could then immediately steal his guilds and destroy them. That is what happened. They are powertripping folks. Ruqqus has abandoned free speech and not having power user cabals and transparency and privacy and all its former values already.

Apparently @JosephGoebbels was permabanned for using alts to bypass the 10 guild limit...something that's *supposed* to only be a 7 day ban!

Sure, if the only guild master is banned, it's a problem. But let's not pretend this is a site with millions of users like reddit and even there, action could be taken individually for such cases. Way to defend reddit tier bullshit. He wasn't inactive for 60 days, he was permabanned, which apparently makes the guild instantly available for a siege. What a healthy and beneficial way to transfer a community! It's really just reddit jannies replacing mods, with extra steps.

Sure, if the only guild master is banned, it's a problem. But let's not pretend this is a site with millions of users like reddit and even there, action could be taken individually for such cases. It could be a lazy, temporary solution, but considering cap is smugly posting his "help" link on a post where his rule resulted in the objectively worst possible outcome, this is simply used as a tool for censorship.

body: Cap you have a long road ahead, and there’s gonna be a lot of controversy, which inevitably will bring criticism. I just want to say thanks for taking that burden. You guys will have to find the balance between free speech and a usable site. Reddit went too far one way. Voat went too far the other. If you can thread this needle, I have no doubt that you will have a legacy to be proud of, but you can give rise to something truly meaningful and valuable here. Keep going.
body_html: Cap you have a long road ahead, and there’s gonna be a lot of controversy, which inevitably will bring criticism. I just want to say thanks for taking that burden. You guys will have to find the balance between free speech and a usable site. Reddit went too far one way. Voat went too far the other. If you can thread this needle, I have no doubt that you will have a legacy to be proud of, but you can give rise to something truly meaningful and valuable here. Keep going.

body:
So IOW it's even more prone to failure.  Well, I suppose it's only a failure if the goal is the stated one and with what's happened here it's pretty clear they lied.

> P.S. It's Christmas, and the admins just rolled out several big guild-related features. Go easy on them, alright?

No.  If they're dumb enough to ignore one of the most basic rules of software development (don't push to prod right before the holidays unless you want to spend the whole time dealing with the fallout) then they deserve what they're getting.  Unless you're doing a prod push for something holiday related there is no reason whatsoever to push changes to prod at this time.  There's a reason most shops run a code freeze from Thanksgiving until after New Year's.

Unless you're doing a prod push for something holiday related there is no reason whatsoever to push changes to prod at this time. There's a reason most shops run a code freeze from Thanksgiving until after New Year's.
